result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Vela was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work/treatment/school. Sentence to commence on May 8, 2014 by noon. Defendant may have release privileges to the Day Reporting Center after serving the first 6 months of this sentence. Court ordere fine/costs waived for this count due to defendants low income.
Consecutive to: any sentence with credit for zero days served.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in stipulated amount of $1000.00 to Ravi S. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment. Remaining restitution to be determined on the next court date.
Court ordered all court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation.
No possession nor use of any weapons or firearms.

No contact with any of the victims, the places of employment or residences.
No new arrests rising to probable cause.
No voting until civil rights are restored.

Cooperate with DOC.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.
Provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided and pay the cost of same.

Attorney James J Connolly in court, defendant Daniel A Vela not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sheryl Kuhary for the City of West Allis appears.  Status conference held in chambers and adjourned to June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  kmw

CORRECTION:
The entry of 05-01-14 under Conditions of Probation for Count 4 should have stated RESTITUTION of $1000.00 is to be paid to RAVI S. (not Robbie S)

Defendant Daniel A Vela in court with attorney James J Connolly.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4 ONLY:

  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Angela V.

AS TO COUNT 4:
  Sentencing proceeds..
Court sentenced defendant to serve a consecutive term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. Credit given for 4 days time served if revoked.
.
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-random urine screens;
-pay restitution in stipulated amount of $1000.00 to Robbie S.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement.  Remaining restitution to be determined on the next court date.
-provide a DNA sample if one has not previously been provided and pay the cost of same;
-Court ordered all court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation;
-no contact with ant of the victims, the places of employment or residenses
-cooperate with DOC
-no new arrests rising to probable cause
-maintain employment and or schooling.
-No possession nor use of any weapons or firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.
.Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 1:

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for zero days served; Huber privileges for work / treatment /school. Sentence to commence on May 8, 2014 by noon.  Defendant may have release priviles to the Dasy Reporting Center after serving the first 6 months of this sentence.

Court ordered fine/costs waived for this count due to defendants low income.

Case is adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 34.

Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant. -  Restitution hearing scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense Sentencing Recommendation.  kmw

Defendant Daniel A Vela in court with attorney James J. Connolly.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counts 2 and 3:  Dismissed and read-in
Counts 1 and 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  firearm possession / voting.  Defendant ordered continued compliance with JPoint, additionally provide school verifications (grades / attendance)  for the sentencing.  Sentencing calendared for MAY 1, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw
(2) Letters filed.

Defendant Daniel A Vela in court with attorney James J Connolly.  Tyrone St. Junior for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/21/14.

Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
